member.name: T:libplctag.NativeImport.DEBUG_LEVELS
member.summary:
The library provides debugging output when enabled. There are three ways to set the debug level (for historical reasons):
Adding a debug attribute to the attribute string when creating a tag: "protocol=XXX&...&debug=4".
Using the function to set the debug attribute.
Using the function.
The preferred method in code is the last one.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.DEBUG_LEVELS.PLCTAG_DEBUG_NONE
member.summary: Disables debugging output.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.DEBUG_LEVELS.PLCTAG_DEBUG_ERROR
member.summary: Only output errors. Generally these are fatal to the functioning of the library.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.DEBUG_LEVELS.PLCTAG_DEBUG_WARN
member.summary: Outputs warnings such as error found when checking a malformed tag attribute string or when unexpected problems are reported from the PLC.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.DEBUG_LEVELS.PLCTAG_DEBUG_INFO
member.summary: Outputs diagnostic information about the internal calls within the library. Includes some packet dumps.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.DEBUG_LEVELS.PLCTAG_DEBUG_DETAIL
member.summary: Outputs detailed diagnostic information about the code executing within the library including packet dumps.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.DEBUG_LEVELS.PLCTAG_DEBUG_SPEW
member.summary: Outputs extremely detailed information. Do not use this unless you are trying to debug detailed information about every mutex lock and release. Will output many lines of output per millisecond. You have been warned!

member.name: T:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES
member.summary: The library provides functions to register a callback on a tag. These events generate a call to that callback.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES.PLCTAG_EVENT_READ_STARTED
member.summary: A read of the tag has been requested. The callback is called immediately before the underlying protocol implementation is called.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES.PLCTAG_EVENT_READ_COMPLETED
member.summary: The callback is called after a read completes. The final status of the read is passed to the callback as well.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES.PLCTAG_EVENT_WRITE_STARTED
member.summary: As with reads, the callback is called when a write is requested. The callback can change the data in the tag and the changes will be sent to the PLC.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES.PLCTAG_EVENT_WRITE_COMPLETED
member.summary: The callback is called when the PLC indicates that the write has completed. The status of the write is passed to the callback.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES.PLCTAG_EVENT_ABORTED
member.summary: The callback function is called when something calls on the tag.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES.PLCTAG_EVENT_DESTROYED
member.summary: The callback function is called when the tag is being destroyed. It is not safe to call any API functions on the tag at this time. This is purely for the callback to manage any application state.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.EVENT_CODES.PLCTAG_EVENT_CREATED
member.summary: The callback is called after a tag creation completes. The final status of the creation is passed to the callback as well. This is not as well supported in some cases, so only depend on this for normal tags and not tags like @tags.

member.name: T:libplctag.NativeImport.plctag
member.summary:
This class provides low-level (raw) access to the native libplctag library (which is written in C). The purpose of this package is to expose the API for this native library, and handle platform and configuration issues.
See for documentation.

member.name: P:libplctag.NativeImport.plctag.ForceExtractLibrary
member.summary: During initialization, this package extracts to disk the appropriate native library. By default, it will overwrite files with the same filename (plctag.dll, libplctag.so, or libplctag.dylib). If you wish to disable this behaviour and use a different native library (e.g. one that you've compiled yourself, or a pre-release), you can disable the Force Extract feature by setting this value to false.

member.name: T:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES
member.summary: Most functions return a status code. It will be one of these.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_STATUS_PENDING
member.summary: Operation in progress. Not an error.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_STATUS_OK
member.summary: No error.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_ABORT
member.summary: The operation was aborted.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_CONFIG
member.summary: The operation failed due to incorrect configuration. Usually returned from a remote system.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_CONNECTION
member.summary: The connection failed for some reason. This can mean that the remote PLC was power cycled, for instance.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_DATA
member.summary: The data received from the remote PLC was undecipherable or otherwise not able to be processed. Can also be returned from a remote system that cannot process the data sent to it.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_DEVICE
member.summary: Usually returned from a remote system when something addressed does not exist.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_GATEWAY
member.summary: Usually returned when the library is unable to connect to a remote system.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_PARAM
member.summary: A common error return when something is not correct with the tag creation attribute string.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_REPLY
member.summary: Usually returned when the remote system returned an unexpected response.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BAD_STATUS
member.summary: Usually returned by a remote system when something is not in a good state.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_CLOSE
member.summary: An error occurred trying to close some resource.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_CREATE
member.summary: An error occurred trying to create some internal resource.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_DUPLICATE
member.summary: An error returned by a remote system when something is incorrectly duplicated (i.e. a duplicate connection ID).

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_ENCODE
member.summary: An error was returned when trying to encode some data such as a tag name.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_MUTEX_DESTROY
member.summary: An internal library error. It would be very unusual to see this.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_MUTEX_INIT
member.summary: An internal library error. It would be very unusual to see this.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_MUTEX_LOCK
member.summary: An internal library error. It would be very unusual to see this.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_MUTEX_UNLOCK
member.summary: An internal library error. It would be very unusual to see this.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NOT_ALLOWED
member.summary: Often returned from the remote system when an operation is not permitted.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: Often returned from the remote system when something is not found.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
member.summary: returned when a valid operation is not implemented.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NO_DATA
member.summary: Returned when expected data is not present.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NO_MATCH
member.summary: Similar to

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NO_MEM
member.summary: Returned by the library when memory allocation fails.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NO_RESOURCES
member.summary: Returned by the remote system when some resource allocation fails.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_NULL_PTR
member.summary: Usually an internal error, but can be returned when an invalid handle is used with an API call.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_OPEN
member.summary: Returned when an error occurs opening a resource such as a socket.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_OUT_OF_BOUNDS
member.summary: Usually returned when trying to write a value into a tag outside of the tag data bounds.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_READ
member.summary: Returned when an error occurs during a read operation. Usually related to socket problems.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_REMOTE_ERR
member.summary: An unspecified or untranslatable remote error causes this.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_THREAD_CREATE
member.summary: An internal library error. If you see this, it is likely that everything is about to crash.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_THREAD_JOIN
member.summary: Another internal library error. It is very unlikely that you will see this.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_TIMEOUT
member.summary: An operation took too long and timed out.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: More data was returned than was expected.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_TOO_SMALL
member.summary: Insufficient data was returned from the remote system.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_UNSUPPORTED
member.summary: The operation is not supported on the remote system.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_WINSOCK
member.summary: A Winsock-specific error occurred (only on Windows).

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_WRITE
member.summary: An error occurred trying to write, usually to a socket.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_PARTIAL
member.summary: Partial data was received or something was unexpectedly incomplete.

member.name: F:libplctag.NativeImport.STATUS_CODES.PLCTAG_ERR_BUSY
member.summary: The operation cannot be performed as some other operation is taking place.
